>
> Test Isolat=
ion
> a
> The constructor is run once, setUp (or @Before) is run before eac=
h test
> method. If you want to make sure each test has the same setup/conf=
iguration
> before the test executes, put it in setUp. If, on the other han=
d, you want
> to make sure all tests in a test case use the same values, pu=
t it in the

Not exactly:  since JUnit creates a brand new =
instance of your test class
before every test method, putting code in your =
constructor is exactly
equivalent to putting it in setUp().
